snippet: Mr. Trump’s endorsement of the aggressive crime-fighting tactic, whose legality has been challenged, collides with his recent courtship of African-American voters....
abstract: Donald J Trump, during town hall-style discussion in Cleveland, endorses widespread use of stop-and-frisk policing across America; data shows polarizing crime-fighting policy, which was ruled unconstitutional in New York, disproportionately targets blacks; move is seen as counterproductive and alienating to black voters Trump has been aggressively courting.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO, MAGGIE HABERMAN and YAMICHE ALCINDOR
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from Cleveland Heights, Ohio, and Nick Corasaniti contributed from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump’s endorsement of the aggressive crime-fighting tactic, whose legality has been challenged, collides with his recent courtship of African-American voters.

headline.main: Donald Trump Embraces Wider Use of Stop-and-Frisk by Police
headline.print_headline: Trump Backs Stop-and-Frisk Across the U.S.
